div.p: The purpose of a treatment. The value set includes 'curative' and 'palliative'. Curative is defined as any treatment meant to reduce or control a disease process, even if a 'cure' is not anticipated. Palliative includes treatments meant to reduce symptoms and side effects, such as antiemetics.
